title: QG Config
description: Configuration of a QG with fixed requirements structure. Auto-generated, do not change!

title.const: Project management
Measures from the preceding maturity levels and/or QGs are incorporated, are monitored and are effectively introduced.

text.const: All QGs: Measures from the previous IGs, SEs und QGs are incorporated and effectively introduced.

title.const:
Project dates / schedule (agile: Product and Sprint Backlog) is updated and
is met.

text.const:
The project schedule is agreed with all participants.
The target dates are up-to-date and achievable.
The impact of the target dates on the subprojects and components has been analyzed.
The next sprints are planned / defined.
The agreed customer features of a contract are prioritized and deviation are agreed by the customer.
Customer milestones are taken into account.

title.const: The project budget is met.

text.const: The proportionate project budget was met in each project phase.

title.const: Lessons Learned are observed / generated.

text.const:
QG0: Existing lessons learned have been evaluated and taken into consideration.
Lessons learned from actual, comparable or processor projects has been taken into account. For critical issues a action is defined and followed up. 

QG5: Lessons learned completed and implemented.

title.const: Interfaces to the other projects / products are considered.

text.const: Dependencies / impact from other projects / other products are considered (e.g. capacity consideration in parallel projects; synergistic effects, carry over-parts)

title.const:
It is known, whether and which Open Source Software is included in the product. 
The license conditions are complied with.

text.const:
At SW-QG0 the systematic assessment of all Open Source components as well as the SW-scan have to be scheduled if no scan exception applies.
The SW-Scan must have been performed at SW-QG4, unless there is a scan exception.

It is demonstrably known whether and which Open Source Software is included in the product including delivered software. 
The license conditions of all Open Source- and proprietary software components are complied with.

title.const:
Was the project specific quality assurance  plan (PSQAP) updated?
The Q targets (also for partial projects and components) can be realized / are reached

text.const:
QG-Level 1-3:
The quality targets can be achieved according to updated quality preview.
QG4/QG5: The quality targets have been achieved.

title.const:
Has the Definition of Ready and Definition of Done been defined / updated in the team? 
Did the stories have adequate acceptance criteria?

text.const: Sprint Planning

title.const: Have all required data protection contracts been determined and established (e.g. with suppliers and subcontractors)?

text.const:
All target markets considered?

Info: PROMAP-Template: Processing Description (Chapter: Data Recipients)

title.const: Security

If privacy relevant:
Has the Customer / User Information Leaflet been filled?

text.const:
Deliverable:
Customer / User Information Leaflet

title.const:
If privacy relevant:
Has the Processing Description been completely documented?

text.const:
Deliverable:
Processing Description incl. Primary and Supporting assets

title.const: Has the Data Protection Checklist been completed?

text.const:
Deliverable :
Data Protection Checklist (also known as Data Privacy and IoTP Relevance Assessment)

title.const: Requirements management
Legal / official requirements / restrictions and regulations are known and were considered.
Requirements in relation to product development codex are known and considered (added to the requirements list).
The requirements for the product safety are known and were considered.

If security relevant:
The requirements for information security and data protection are considered.

text.const:
QG0: 
• Requirements for information security are known (prescreening).
QG3/4, QGC3/4: 
• Requirements for information security are considered
• Data protection compliance is ensured / met
• Local restrictions/laws and requirements of target markets are considered

Data protection: 
If personal data is processed in the Bosch product, then the data protection compliance (incl. all checks and documentations) have to be guaranteed in the project course (even if QGs Level 1-3 are omitted).

title.const: UX-relevance has been evaluated and UX activities are planned and implemented according to BCI definitions.

text.const:
QG0: UX relevance evaluated; 
UX activities are considered in the initial requirements, planned and will be implemented starting from QG0

QG3/QG4: UX activities are implemented

In case of UX Relevance a patent strategy with UX focus determined

title.const: All known functional and non-functional requirements (internal and/or from customer) that are relevant for the product approval / the release or for the QG  as well as their acceptance criteria are defined / fulfilled.

text.const:
QG0: QGR-relevant requirements are available;
QG4: requirements are implemented

Define the extent to which the acceptance criteria are to be checked in a review.
Safety-related requirements must be designated as such.
Performance requirements to be considered.
SW: Bidirectional traceability of the requirements for the code and test cases must be ensured.

title.const: Product development

The interaction of the components is analyzed and assured. 
Has a SW architecture  been documented/updated and reviewed by the relevant parties / stakeholder?

text.const:
Functional and safe Interaction:
The cause-effect relationships of the components (mechanics, HW, SW) were analyzed and observed in the development. Changes were observed. Functionality of the system was verified.

title.const:
The applicable rules for
• SW architecture and detailed design
• Coding
• Re-use
• Critical computer resources
are identified and met.

text.const: Applicable rules are defined in the GE or by customer

title.const: The quality of re-used software was inspected and adjusted where needed.

text.const:
QG0: determine which software shall be re-used and which open issues might be known.
QGR, QG4: Removal of open issues is determined and changes to re-used software will be re-based if required.

title.const: Verification / validation
The test strategy was defined/adhered to.

text.const:
QG0: Test strategy was defined
QGR/QG4: test strategy was adhered to

title.const: The agreed product and process tests for the time of the QG were performed and their results are good.

text.const: Remark: At SW-QG0 the process test may e.g. be a supplier self-declaration.

title.const: All safety-related requirements are tested and errors removed.

text.const: Industry-specific standards are to be observed

title.const: All security-related requirements are tested and errors removed

text.const: Have the assurance/testing methods according to the project’s security level been performed and updated as well as the findings re-evaluated?

title.const:
If security relevant:
Has a penetration test been performed and findings been re-evaluated in accordance with the penetration test requirements?

text.const:
Deliverable:
Penetration Test report

title.const: Errors / open items / "known issues" have been evaluated and dealt with.

text.const:
"dealt with" means e.g.
 - errors are analyzed, severity judged,  prioritized and mapped to releases
 - known errors and existing workarounds are transferred to Operation and Support
 - SW-QG4: Notification to customer if functions are not met to the specified scope
 - …

title.const: Has a virus scan been performed on all product software artifacts?

text.const: Virus Scan Report

title.const: The installation procedure incl. documentation is verified.

text.const: It should be tested if the SW can be installed on a fresh system by following the documented installation procedure, or in case of an update on systems with older versions of the SW.

title.const: The data protection documentation was reviewed by the DSPiE

text.const: Review result is documented, evaluated and required measures are implemented

title.const: Procurement/ external procurement
The required purchased parts and services have the necessary maturity.

text.const:
If required, technical and delivery risks are identified for new parts and carry-over parts.  
QG1: Approval by project purchase department for the BOM (Bill of material) is available.

interim order specification up to QG2, order specification up to QG3 and/or at the latest QG4

New parts: Assessment based on the available Purchasing Reviews (Purchasing Evaluation); 
Carry-over parts, -components and materials: see deadlines in order specifications;
Risk management to ensure capability to deliver (new parts and carry-over parts; R: Purchase)
Material release: as per RB/GF 131 concluded on time (Automotive: QGC2, Non-Automotive: QG4)

Change management agreed / regulated

title.const: SW commissioned by means of a specification document was accepted on the basis of the specification document.
Have the used third party components been checked regarding open source licensing and security vulnerabilities?
Change management in the project
The requirements were reviewed for changes, impact considered and communicated within the supply chain.
Risk management
Project-specific risk management performed and approved.

text.const:
Relevant risks assessed; measures defined; effectivity of the measures assessed.
The updated project risk analysis is available and is confirmed if required.

title.const: Technical risk analysis (product) is available, up to date and confirmed.

text.const:
By QG1 / SW-QGR: current edition of the Design-FMEA* created;
By QG4/ SW-QG4: current Design-FMEA* edition/ risk analysis available, which represents the state of SOP.

*FMEA is the method to be used in the automobile industry (IATF16949, ISO26262). Additional technical risk analysis can be requested.
In other branches, alternative methods are permissible for the technical risk analysis.

Current approach at BCI: 
HW: FMEA
SW: Focus Area Matrix (FAM)

title.const:
If security relevant:
Has the security risk assessment been performed and is up-to-date?

text.const:
Quality Indicators for all QGs:
• Has the scope and the architecture been defined?
• Has the predefined list of sources for security requirements and standards relevant to the project taken into account?
• (QG0: As far as known: ) Have all primary and supporting assets been identified?
• (QG0: As far as known: ) Have all primary assets been classified according to the protection classes from a data protection perspective?
• (QG0: As far as known: ) Have the  primary assets been classified according to the protection classes (SC- described in CD2900) from a security perspective?
• (QG0: As far as known: ) Have the supporting assets been classified according to the required protection classes? 

Additional indicators for QG4
• Has the baseline security approach been followed for each supporting asset to identify requirements?
• Have requirements been identified for business logic, the specific domain and the communication? (Approach can be additional threat modelling chapter in the template)
• Has the documentation been sent to the ProSO

Deliverable:
Security Risk Assessment incl. Primary and Supporting Assets

title.const:
If security relevant:
Have security risks been documented in the Security Risk list?

text.const:
Quality Indicators:
QG4:
• Do all risks have one of the following statuses (Mitigated, Accepted, Resolved)?
• If risks have been accepted, is the person authorized to accept a specific risk?
• Due date should not be in the past
• Has the resulting risk of not implementing a requirement been made transparent to the project lead? 
• ProSO has been informed about the security risks?

Deliverable:
Security Risk List

title.const:
If security relevant:
Has the security concept been performed and is up-to-date?

text.const:
Quality Indicators:
• Does the security concept contain a list of requirements derived from the catalogues and has, including information about the implementation details and status for each supporting asset?
• Have the required applicable security requirements been identified for external components/assets and the status been documented?
• Does the security concept include additional information regarding secure operations and administration, development environment security, secure decommissioning?

Deliverable:
Security Concept

title.const: Provided SW / COTS were dealt with in the risk management.

text.const: COTS: commercial off the shelf / standard products

title.const: Has the Data Protection Risk Assessment been performed and signed?

text.const:
Deliverable:
Tab Data Protection Risk Assessment in Excel file of C/ISP

title.const: Configuration management
Configuration management is specified and adhered to.

text.const:
Standard archiving and labeling of project documents according to CD02900 / BCI DI 0100 including Traceability is assured.
Special requirements (e.g. customer requirement) are met in relation to the archiving and labeling of the documents.

title.const: A baseline was drawn and it was reviewed whether the baseline is complete with reference to the specified Configuration Items

text.const: It is defined, which Configuration Items are relevant for the delivery / release, a baseline is created from this and checked for completeness. The allocation of the baseline to the QG has to be unambiguous.

title.const: Has a Release Note been created including migration notes / guide  (SW Version, functionality, implemented issues, Test coverage, release level General Availability /Limited Availability….)?

text.const: Release Note

title.const: Training and Enabling

Enabling concept and material available, trainers / consultants assigned.
Technical enabling of consultants & application engineers has been executed.
